column2: MISSISSIPPI PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. If your wheels drop off the pavement edge, you should:
column4: turn back onto the roadway immediately.
column6: turn gradually back onto the roadway when safe.

column2: 2. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
column6: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column8: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.

column2: 3. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.
column6: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.
column8: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.

column2: 4. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column6: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 5. A bad car suspension can cause:
6. This road sign means:
7. Which statement about taking medications and driving is true?
column4: Cold medications can make a person drowsy.
column6: Prescribed drugs are safe to take at any time.
column8: Over the counter drugs do not affect driving ability.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column8: Side road entering from the left

11. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
12. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column8: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 13. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column6: prepare to leave the lane safely.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
15. Drivers may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if:
column4: the yellow line next to the other side of the road is broken.
column6: the vehicle ahead moves to the right to let them pass.
column8: the yellow line next to their side of the road is broken.

column2: 16. A flashing red light at an intersection means:
column6: Stop and wait for the green light
column8: Stop and yield the right of way.

column2: 17. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.
column8: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.

19. If you approach a flashing red traffic light, you should treat the intersection the same as:
20. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
column6: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.

column2: 21. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column6: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 22. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column6: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column8: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.

column2: 23. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column6: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
column8: Wait for the next green light.

column2: 24. When following another vehicle at night, drivers should use:
25. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
column8: find a safe place to stop for a break.

column2: 26. This sign indicates that:
column4: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.
column6: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
column8: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.

column2: 27. Diamond-shaped signs:
column6: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.

column2: 28. The yield sign means:
column4: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
column6: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column8: You must come to a complete stop.
